intro: Loeflingia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered loeflingia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It features small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a hairy texture that helps it retain moisture in its native habitat.
